result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Spelzini was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

auto repairs: $240.17
lost wages: $1000
other expenses: $14, $17.36, $8.68, $17.36, $17.36, $28.68, $26.88, $24.64, $25.60, $24.00, $22.00, $41.75

Court informs Mr. Spelzini that he will pay restitution through probation as ordered by Agent.

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 10% restitution surcharge.

further auto repairs: $240.17

$17.36
$8.68
$17.36

records.addlTxt: Clerks note: The blood testing fee was ordered in the OWI 1st case. The Court vacated the fee on this case

Case called at 10:12 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Richard L Spelzini in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
off-record: 10:28 - 10:30 am for Mr. Spelzini to consult with counsel

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety 
--No consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--Random alcohol screens
--To submit to and cooperate with any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain employment
--To pay costs of this action
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $72 subpoena fees
--To pay $56.74 blood testing fee (FAPD) - if was ordered in OWI 1st - Court will vacate
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution to be determined
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee to be determined

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:05 am

[MK] case called at 8:42am.
Defendant Richard L Spelzini in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Spelzini indicates that his name includes "Jr."
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the parties are working toward a resolution agreement in this case; he requests that the case be scheduled for another status in a few weeks.
Instead the Court sets the case for Preliminary Hearing. 
recess 8:43qm. 
reconvene 8:44am.
The Court grants the oral Motion of the State to Amend the Complaint to add an a/k/a for the Defendant's name, adding "Jr." as a suffix. The Court directs the clerk to include this in the case caption. 
recess 8:45am.

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 8/10/15 at 9:00am.
Status conference on June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Statement of Typical Cost - Blood Draw in the amount of $56.74 received from the JCSD

Case called at 1:33 pm [sf]
Defendant Richard L Spelzini in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa advises that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Defendant indicates that he is a Jr.
Address and DOB information verified or DOB verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court and Attorney Flint discuss the penalty for Count #2; Count #2 is charged as a felony but the penalty is listed as jail.
Attorney Flint indicates taht it is charged properly.
Court enters "not guilty" on Count #2. Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties for Count #1.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-Not drive without valid drivers license
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-Take all prescription medications as prescribed
-No contact with Rhonda Davenport or Jonathan Green
-Defendant is not to be at any place that Rhonda Davenport or Jonathan Green where they may reside or work.

Attorney De La Rosa has concerns since he hasn't had a spit plea during this rotation, and he hasn't had time to speak with his client regarding substitution.
Court grants the Defense 10 days to substitute.

Recess: 1:40 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 6/17/15 at 10:00 am
Status: 6/30/15 at 8:30 am
